isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - INSTALL - MASTER CYLINDER

svcproc.title: MASTER CYLINDER
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 7 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position the master cylinder (Item 6) flange over the Hydro-Max™ booster threaded studs (Item 11).

Position relay (Item 2) with relay mounting bracket (Item 4) in place over two outboard threaded studs (Item 11) and install four hex flanged nuts (Item 9) securing the master cylinder (Item 6) to the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 10). Tighten to 25 to 30 lbf-ft (34 to 41 N•m).
Thread each of the hydraulic brake line hex fittings (Item 5) into master cylinder (Item 6) and tighten finger tight.

Fill master cylinder reservoir with brake fluid. When brake fluid touches the bottom of the half cylindrical portion of either of the fill port openings, the master cylinder is full. Loosen each brake line hex fitting (Item 5) enough to allow brake fluid to seep out past the fittings. When seepage starts, tighten fittings. Tighten to 16 to 17 lbf-ft (22 to 23 N•m).
Connect wiring harness pressure differential switch connector (Item 7) to the pressure differential switch (Item 8).
Bleed the brakes, refer to BLEEDING HYDRAULIC BRAKE SYSTEM .
Connect battery ground cable and unblock the vehicle wheels.

svcproc.para: With the engine running, step on the brake pedal several times to make sure the pedal feels normal. Check the brake line hex fittings at the master cylinder and bleeder screws at each wheel for leakage. Tighten if necessary. Road test the vehicle to make sure the vehicle stops properly.
